text: Filippo Taglioni (5 November 1777 â€“ 11 February 1871) was an Italian choreographer of the 19th century. His greatest work was the ballet, La Sylphide. Most of his work has been lost. He taught his daughter, Marie Taglioni to dance. She became one of the greatest ballerinas in history. Category:1777 births Category:1871 deaths Category:Italian choreographers
title: Filippo Taglioni
